result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas T Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory DNA surcharge, pay all court costs/fees. surcharges; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Pay $50.00 monthly for all monetary obligations starting JUNE 1 2014 with payment plan to be completed within 1 year.

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
No cash bail nond was posted in this matter.
Civil judgment warning given

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas T Lewis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

THIS ENTRY IS TO CORRECT/AMEND AMENDED INFORMATION PORTION OF 03-11-2014 PLEA AND SENTENCING COURT RECORD. 
After conferring with ADA Thomas Potter regarding the Wisconsin State Statute and Class noted in the Amended Information filed in this matter, Court Record is AMENDED to reflect the following:
COUNT 1 AMENDED to Attempting To Flee Or Elude A Traffic Officer, contrary to 346.04(2t), a CLASS UNKNOWN MISDEMEANOR.

Defendant Nicholas T Lewis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Nicholas T Lewis in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
-  Amended Information, FILED.
COUNT 1 AMENDED to Attempting To Flee Or Elude A Traffic Officer, contrary to 346.04(2t), a CLASS A MISDEMEANOR.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state and defense counsel.
Court ordered defendant to serve 41 days in the House of Correction, with 41 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court Orders Defendant to :
-  Pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge, failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-  Pay all Court Costs/Fees/Surcharges, failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-  Pay $50.00 MONTHLY for all monetary obligations starting JUNE 01 2014 with payment plan to be completed within 1 YEAR. 
-  No Cash Bail Bond was posted in this matter.
-  Civil Judgment Warning given.

At the request of both State and Defense Counsel, Plea and Sentencing adjourned from 03-10-2014 at 1:30pm to 03-11-2014 at 08:30am in Branch 22.   DEFENDANT TO BE PRODUCED FOR SAME.
FILE TO REMAIN IN COURTROOM FOR HEARING.

Call received from Assistant District Attorney Thomas Potter and Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont to schedule Plea and Sentencing date at a earlier time than the 03-24-2014 at 08:30am previously scheduled.  Plea and Sentencing scheduled for 03-10-2014 at 01:30pm, with the understanding that the hearing will not take place if Jury Trial is in process in this Court.  Plea Hearing scheduled on 03-24-2014 remains calendared in the event earlier date for Plea and Sentencing is not held.
With same terms and conditions as previously set.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted in part and denied in part by the Court.  Bail adjusted down to $1,000.00, with same terms and conditions as previously set.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Nicholas T Lewis not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea Hearing scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for 03-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas T Lewis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Nicholas T Lewis in custody.  Jacob Corr for Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Defendant Nicholas T Lewis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Nicholas T Lewis in custody.  William Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
